laboratory_examinations.findings: Fasting blood glucose: 81 mg/dL; 2-hour blood glucose: 120 mg/dL; Insulin levels: Fasting: 33.7 IU/mL; 2-hour: 219 IU/mL
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: At age 27, diagnosed with diabetes; hemoglobin A1c levels consistently elevated.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Fasting blood glucose: 81 mg/dL; 2-hour blood glucose: 137 mg/dL; Insulin levels: Fasting: 28 IU/mL; 2-hour: 180 IU/mL
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Adult noted elevated fasting blood sugars (peak: 154 mg/dL) but never received medical therapy for diabetes.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Mild lymphopenia; reduced number of natural killer and B cells, mild decrease in CD4 T cells, with normal numbers of CD8 T cells.

laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Persistent anemia of unknown origin throughout childhood and young adulthood.
At age 18, consistent primary gonadal failure with marked hypergonadotropic hypogonadism.

laboratory_examinations.findings: LH: 44.6 mIU/mL, FSH: 62.3 mIU/mL, T: 10 ng/dL at age 13, T: 30 ng/dL at age 18.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Estrogen replacement therapy needed but patient displayed persistent hypogonadism at age 19.

laboratory_examinations.procedure_name: Biochemical Assessment for Diabetes and Dyslipidemia
laboratory_examinations.findings: Consistently elevated HbA1c levels; diagnosed with dyslipidemia, treated with a statin.
